title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The answer need not be simplified but must be equivalent to 24.

If errors are made in simplification, the point is not earned.

The answer must have accompanying work, specifically the sum of two products.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

First point:

“Displacement” can be written as “change in position.”

“Distance traveled” or “total meters” is not acceptable.

The time interval must be specific, i.e., t=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGimaaaa@35EB@ to t=16 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGymaiaaiAdaaaa@36AC@ seconds; at t=16 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGymaiaaiAdaaaa@36AC@ seconds is not acceptable.

“Over 16 seconds” is not acceptable.

Second point:

“Meters” may be stated as the units in part (a) or in part (b). The point is earned in either case, unless some other unit is re(stated) in part (b).

“Seconds” need not be stated as the variable t was defined in the problem stem.

Units point may be earned without the interpretation point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The connection of velocity to x ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@388D@ need not be explicit; any specific reference to x ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@388D@ or specific values in the table will indicate the connection and earn the point.

Second point:

Both conditions must be stated, i.e., the continuity of x ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@388D@ and the bounding of 0 by two values of x ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@388D@ of opposite signs.

The conditions point requires x ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@388D@ is differentiable and therefore continuous. The point is not earned for just x ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@388D@ is differentiable and continuous.

The interval upon which x ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@388D@ is continuous and/or differentiable does not need to be stated. If stated, it must be a correct interval with the possible exception of inclusion/exclusion of the endpoints.

The values of x ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@388D@ must explicitly bound 0, either verbally or symbolically.

Intervals need not be presented using mathematical notation; for example, “ x ′  ( 0 )>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A10@ and x ′  ( 4 )<0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A2F@ ” or “ x ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@388D@ changes signs between t=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadshacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@360B@ and t=4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadshacqGH9aqpcaaI0aaaaa@360F@ ” are both acceptable.

A general statement such as “ x ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@388D@ changes signs” is not acceptable.

Third point:

Intermediate Value Theorem (or IVT) need not be explicitly stated.

This point is earned for an affirmative conclusion and bounding 0 by two values of opposite signs pulled from the table.

A response could earn the first and third points without earning the second point if conditions are presented but not sufficiently justified and the conclusion is correct.

The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

This point is earned for a response that provides clear evidence of an understanding of Euler’s method presented in a table or in the form shown in the model solution.

This point could still be earned in the presence of a single error.

If the method is displayed in a table with no column/row labels, this point is only earned for a completely correct final answer (and in that case, both points are earned).

If the method is displayed in a table with no column/row labels and there is an error in one or more of the values in the table, neither point is earned.

Second point:

This point is earned only by final answer of 3 or equivalent with accompanying work. That answer does not need to be simplified.

The second point cannot be earned without the first point.

Both points are earned for a response of 11+1.2 ⋅ 4−3.2 ⋅ 4. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@481F@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

All terms must be correct in order to earn the point.

Using another variable (such as x) is acceptable as long as that variable is used correctly in both non-constant terms.

Coefficients need not be simplified, i.e., − 4.4 2! MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39AD@ is acceptable.

Additional terms or “ + ⋯ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHRaWkcaaMe8UaeS47IWeaaa@378F@ ” added to the polynomial fail to earn the point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

s ( 7 )  ( −1 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BCB@ must be correct (and numerical) but need not be simplified.

Second point:

The second point will be earned for a correct structure for the seventh-degree term even if the derivative value is incorrect; that is, a form of derivative value 7! ( t+1 ) 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48F1@ earns the point regardless of the derivative value’s correctness.

The derivative value must be numerical; i.e., ( t+3 ) 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@389E@ in the numerator is not acceptable.

Setting the derivative equal to the term will not earn the point, for example, ( t+3 ) 6 = ( −1+3 ) 6 = 2 6 7! ( t+1 ) 7 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A55@

Multiple terms of degree less than seven that are presented (even if circled or boxed) will not be read.

A response such as b  7! ( t+1 ) 7 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D25@ where b is the previously incorrectly computed value of s ( 7 )  ( −1 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C9A@ will earn the second point but not the first.

Acceptable forms of the correct term include:

· 2 6 7! ( t+1 ) 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BF4@

· 64 7! ( t+1 ) 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BCF@

· 64 5040 ( t+1 ) 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D5A@

· 4 315 ( t+1 ) 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BE0@

· 0.012 ( t+1 ) 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C3A@

· 0.013 ( t+1 ) 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C3B@
